title: Associated type bound with HRTBs causes an opaque type inference failure
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->
[URLO thread](https://users.rust-lang.org/t/associated-type-bound-with-hrtbs-says-type-doesnt-implement-trait/80441)

I tried this code:
[Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=41d3b1bd3f245f45df4a12ec93f290cf)
```rust
pub trait Trait {}

impl<'a, T> Trait for &'a T where T: Trait {}

impl<'a> Trait for &'a str {}

fn check_hrtb<T>(_: T)
where
    for<'a> &'a T: IntoIterator,
    for<'a> <&'a T as IntoIterator>::Item: Trait,
{
}

fn check<'a, T>(_: T)
where
    T: 'a,
    &'a T: IntoIterator,
    <&'a T as IntoIterator>::Item: Trait,
{
}

fn main() {
    check(["hi"]); // Works
    check_hrtb(["hi"]); // Fails with error below
}
```

I expected to see this happen: `check_hrtb` should infer the type of `T` correctly.

Instead, this happened: The compiler indicates that the trait bounds were not met, however removing the HRTB and using  a normal lifetime in `check` works correctly.
```rust
error[E0277]: the trait bound `for<'a> <&'a _ as IntoIterator>::Item: Trait` is not satisfied
  --> src/main.rs:24:16
   |
24 |     check_hrtb(["hi"]);
   |     ---------- ^^^^^^ the trait `for<'a> Trait` is not implemented for `<&'a _ as IntoIterator>::Item`
   |     |
   |     required by a bound introduced by this call
   |
   = help: the following other types implement trait `Trait`:
             &'a T
             &'a str
note: required by a bound in `check_hrtb`
  --> src/main.rs:10:44
   |
7  | fn check_hrtb<T>(_: T)
   |    ---------- required by a bound in this
...
10 |     for<'a> <&'a T as IntoIterator>::Item: Trait,
   |                                            ^^^^^ required by this bound in `check_hrtb`
```

In the URLO thread quinedot noted that adding an explicit type causes the code to compile with no other changes 
```diff
-    check_hrtb(["hi"]);
+    check_hrtb::<[&str; 1]>(["hi"]);
```
[Playground with fix](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=ab18432256eeafbd24428c6ebd25ecfd)

### Meta

If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc 1.63.0 (4b91a6ea7 2022-08-08)
rustc 1.65.0-nightly (2022-08-26 c07a8b4e09f356c7468b)
```
